name: The Country Cottage Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is beautiful, calm and relaxing. The grounds are beautiful and quiet, rooms are very clean and had a comfortable bed. Staff are very friendly and helpful. The food was amazing could not fault this hotel. I would recommend staying here.
reviews.title: Beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here on a Dinner Bed and Breakfast deal through Groupon, and as a result were not expecting too much. However what we found was a quiet, calm, quirky set of buildings that put together made an atmospheric cottagey environment. Lots of places to sit, some outside in a lovely courtyard and others in little cosy rooms. Our bedroom matched the cottage theme; a lovely settee, beamed ceiling, and country florals abounding. The bathroom was large and a little tired, with a cold tap that really did not work and this was a nuisance.
reviews.title: Lovely ambience
The Restaurant - Back to the Future
reviews.text: Food was adequate, not thrilling. It's a limited menu and the breakfast was similarly rather ordinary. The staff were lovely; friendly and helpful. Our breakfast waitress told us that the chef had gone out to get us croissants as he had none left. That's what I call going the extra mile.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well worth a visit and very good value.
reviews.title: A very pleasant night away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although greeted by a welcoming front of house the experience was mixed from there on out.
reviews.title: blink and you miss it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Like many of the below contributors, my boyfriend and I booked this hotel through the Groupon deal and found that we were more than pleased with the hotel and service that we received. As we were planning a holiday in the UK anyway we were looking for a place in the Midlands to stay overnight and this fit the bill perfectly. It was comfortable and affordable and we enjoyed our stay.
reviews.title: A lovely night away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ruddington itself is more of a drive through place - the hotel's appeal doesn't really lie in the area other than the fact that it is a short distance from Nottingham by car, which was ideal for us. It was easy to find and quite a quiet location despite being so central to the through roads.
reviews.title: What a shame

reviews.text: Our room was really nice - comfortable bed, TV, sofa, clean and functional bathroom with some lovely toiletries provided. It felt very homely and we soon felt settled in, and the staff were very friendly and helpful. The only issue was that the heating was boiling and we couldn't turn it off, though we kept the windows open during our stay so this didn't cause much problem.
reviews.title: Ruddington country cottage hotel the best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our Groupon deal included a meal at the restaurant, which was quite a simple and traditional place but served some beautiful food. We paid a little extra to order sirloin steaks which were delicious, as were the starters. In the morning the breakfast was quite basic - croissants, toast, muesli, fruit - you could order a full English but the food was so filling from the night before that we found there was more than enough choice without!
reviews.title: A pleasant surprise - the clue is in the name

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall Country Cottage Hotel was an excellent stay - we were really pleased with the place itself and the service, and would certainly recommend it for a refreshing night away near Nottingham.
reviews.title: JUST FANTASTIC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just stayed here last night and I have to say it was excellent.
reviews.title: A Fantasic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are very friendly and extremely helpful.
reviews.title: Lovely retreat

reviews.text: The evening meal at the restaurant was fantastic - my wife and I enjoyed every course - simply brilliant!!
reviews.title: Disappointing Restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Try the Blue Monkey beer – it goes down very well 
reviews.title: Another Brilliant Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was very nice, clean, warm and well appointed.
reviews.title: Outstanding A* !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Luckily we stayed here on a groupon deal, if we'd have paid full price i'd have been most unhappy.
reviews.title: We won't be back, dated and average hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good- friendly staff, free parking, reasonably clean
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: Bad- dated decor throughout, dated & uninspiring food menu (fruit salad, apple pie, carrot cake for pudding?!), our room smelt of stale urine coming from the bathroom- this was better if you kept the bathroom door shut at all times, hole in the bed sheet, smell of damp up the stairs to the room, they ran out of ice at the bar. My husband wanted a full English breakfast (this was a £5 addition) the sausage was rock hard. I kept with the inclusive continental option, probably the worst i have ever had. Poor selection, poor presentation, poor quality. The coffee was too weak for my liking, but then i guess some people don't like it strong. The toast & butter was fine so i mainly ate that for breakfast.
reviews.title: Quiet, homely, good value hotel

reviews.text: I can see from other reviews many people love this hotel, so maybe we are just used to better and a bit spoilt. But if think you are like us and like the finer things in life, then don't bother.
reviews.title: Quaint, friendly and comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed there at the end of May for our wedding anniversairy. Has a great time: It is a lovely little hotel with a nice garden area. In our room there was a hot tub which was a nice surprise. Dinner and breakfast was good. Staff were lovely and helpful.
reviews.title: Average hotel

aka: The Country Cottage Hotel Ruddington, England, UK
description: The Country Cottage Hotel specializes in attentive service, unique individually designed bedrooms and quality, locally sourced produce in dishes served daily in our Restaurant and Bar. The perfect venue for all Family functions: birthdays, christenings and weddings. So for that special stay and a good night’s sleep.As you would expect with a country hotel there are beautiful grounds surrounding the hotel with picturesque views from your hotel accommodation. The hotel boasts award winning gardens and courtyard to walk around at your leisure during your stay.
